theme.title: Theme Settings
theme.description: Choose the appearance theme for the app

language.title: Language Settings
language.description: Choose the display language for the app

toolInstall.title: Tool Installation
toolInstall.installedDesc: Your system has Claude Code correctly installed and ready to use.
toolInstall.notInstalled: Follow the steps below to install Claude Code
toolInstall.unsupportedPlatformDesc: Currently only macOS and Windows platforms are supported.
toolInstall.uninstallWarning: Uninstalling Claude Code will remove the tool from the system, but will not affect your configuration files.
toolInstall.confirmUninstallDesc: Are you sure you want to uninstall Claude Code? This will remove the tool from the system, but will not affect your configuration files.
toolInstall.nativeInstallDesc: Install using system native tools for better performance
toolInstall.homebrewDesc: macOS package manager, easy to manage and update

vendor.title: Claude Code Vendor Configuration
vendor.description: Configure different Claude Code API vendors and switch between services
vendor.noVendorsDesc: Click the + button in the upper right corner to add your first vendor configuration
vendor.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this vendor configuration?
vendor.cannotDeleteActive: Cannot delete the currently active configuration, please switch to another configuration first
vendor.killProcessMessage: Detected that Claude Code is running. Do you need to terminate all Claude Code processes for the configuration to take effect immediately?
vendor.killSuccess: Claude Code process has been terminated, configuration will take effect on next startup

dialog.configNameHelper: Leave empty to use vendor name as configuration name
dialog.apiTokenHelper: Enter the API key for the corresponding vendor

vendor.title: Codex Vendor Configuration
vendor.description: Configure different Codex API vendors and switch between services
vendor.killProcessMessage: Detected that Codex is running. Do you need to terminate all Codex processes for the configuration to take effect immediately?
vendor.killSuccess: Codex process has been terminated, configuration will take effect on next startup

dialog.providerKeyHelper: Provider key name in config.toml (lowercase letters, no spaces)

toolInstall.installedDesc: Your system has Codex correctly installed and ready to use.
toolInstall.notInstalled: Follow the steps below to install Codex
toolInstall.uninstallWarning: Uninstalling Codex will remove the tool from the system, but will not affect your configuration files.
toolInstall.confirmUninstallDesc: Are you sure you want to uninstall Codex? This will remove the tool from the system, but will not affect your configuration files.

claudeDocs.title: Global Rules Configuration
claudeDocs.description: Edit and view ~/.claude/CLAUDE.md documentation, this file will be loaded by Claude Code as global rules
claudeDocs.saveFailed: Failed to save document, please try again
claudeDocs.unsavedChanges: You have unsaved changes, please click the Save button to save your edits
claudeDocs.emptyContent: No content yet, please switch to edit mode to start editing
claudeDocs.noFile: Global Rules File Not Created Yet
claudeDocs.noFileDesc: The CLAUDE.md file does not exist yet. This file is used to store Claude Code's global rules, which will apply to all projects. You can create a new file with example content right away.
claudeDocs.createFailed: Failed to create file, please try again

mcp.title: Global MCP Configuration
mcp.description: Manage global MCP server configurations in ~/.claude.json
mcp.noServersDesc: Click the + button in the upper right corner to add your first MCP server
mcp.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this MCP server configuration?
mcp.loadFailed: Failed to load MCP server configurations

stdio.title: STDIO (Standard Input/Output)
stdio.description: Communicates with local processes via standard input/output. Most commonly used for local tools and services. Claude Code will launch the specified command and communicate via stdin/stdout.

http.title: HTTP (HyperText Transfer Protocol)
http.description: Communicates with remote servers via HTTP protocol. Suitable for remote API services. Supports custom headers for authentication (e.g., Bearer Token).

sse.title: SSE (Server-Sent Events)
sse.description: Communicates with remote servers via server-sent events. Suitable for services requiring real-time push. Server can proactively push messages to clients. Supports custom headers.
